question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $S$ be a region in the plane with area 10.  When we apply the matrix
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 7 & -3 \end{pmatrix}\]to $S,$ we obtain the region $S'.$  Find the area of $S'.$
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{130}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Note that
\[\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 7 & -3 \end{vmatrix} = (2)(-3) - (1)(7) = -13,\]so the matrix scales the area of any region by a factor of $|-13| = 13.$  In particular, the area of $S'$ is $13 \cdot 10 = \boxed{130}.$
